-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoo=
groups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of themiwi
Sent: Thur=
sday, August 17, 2006 2:55 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera=
] bug in config/configure ?

Hi group

I'm trying to write a script which l=
argely automates the
download/configureation/build/installation of Cantera =
on the institutes
computers (some of the people here are not very fluent in=
 installing
things on linux).

A problem I encountered is, that the configu=
re script always tries to
build the F90 interface, no matter what value BUI=
LD_F90_INTERFACE has.
I tracked it down into the config/configure script, w=
here the BUILD_F90
variable is assigned correctly 0 or 1. But then, further=
 on, the latter
variable is used in an if statement with test -n:

if test =
-n ${BUILD_F90}; then

which will always result in true. If I'm not mistake=
n, it should read

if [ $BUILD_F90 =3D 1 ]; then


This concerns the source=
 package of version 1.6.0.


Michael









 
Yahoo! Groups Links



 


=
